verses.verse: (A Word of Comfort to Baruch) (Jer 36.1, 4, 18, 32) The word that the prophet Jeremiah spoke to Baruch son of Neriah, when he wrote these words in a scroll at the dictation of Jeremiah, in the fourth year of King Jehoiakim son of Josiah of Judah:
Thus says the LORD, the God of Israel, to you, O Baruch:
(Ps 6.6; 2 Cor 4.1, 16) You said, “Woe is me! The LORD has added sorrow to my pain; I am weary with my groaning, and I find no rest.”
(Isa 5.5; Jer 11.17; 18.7-10) Thus you shall say to him, “Thus says the LORD: I am going to break down what I have built and pluck up what I have planted—that is, the whole land.

(1 Kings 3.9, 11; Jer 21.9; 25.31; 38.2; 39.18; Mt 6.25, 32, 33; Rom 12.16) And you, do you seek great things for yourself? Do not seek them, for I am going to bring disaster upon all flesh, says the LORD, but I will give you your life as a prize of war in every place to which you may go.”
